result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Corey Michael Pottebaum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent but without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of of Conviction.
Defendant to report to Probation today April 27, 2015.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF147.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF147.

-Follow all programming recommendations by Agent.
-Participate in MRT.
-Maintain sobriety.
-Agent to provide updates to the Court 1 week prior to Probation Review Hearings.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. Corey Michael Pottebaum pro se. Case called at 4:29. Court reviews file. DE is working in full time in Hudson. DE is still living with his parents. DE is going to be completing the MRT.
filed by Agent Ben Anderson regarding Defendant's compliance. eif
for Furlough. Signed by SRN on 9/25/2015. fax: Jail.  km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: M. Nieskes DF: Corey Michael Pottebaum appeared from jail. Agent Ben Anderson in court. Case called at 10:04. Court reviews file. Agent Anderson is requesting to lift the stay on the 30 days jail time and impose the 30 days that was initially stayed.  Court questions DE on his right to an Atty. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowlingly waives his right to an Atty. Court is satisfied DE is competent to represent himself. ADA Nieskes requests to impose 30 of the 60 days. DE is satisfied with the 30 days. DE requests a furlough for his sister's wedding. ADA Nieskes responds to a furlough rquest. Court authorizes a furlough. Court lifts the 30 days, DE will serve a straight 30 days not eligible for good time. Court grants huber. 
Court grants furlough:
DE to leave at 2:30 and be back to St. Croix County Jail by 6:30 with not stops either way.
DE to be accompanied by a family member at all times. 
DE to be tested prior to leaving and tested upon return. 
Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times . This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
Probation review hearing at 09-25-2015 10:00 am
from Agent Ben Anderson. gme
Probation review hearing at 11-16-2015 04:30 pm

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA Hartung appears. Corey Michael Pottebaum pro se. Agent Ben Anderson appears by telephone. Case called at 4:46 p.m. Agent Anderson updates Court. Court reviews file. Corey Pottebaum addresses Court and has began to make contacts to initiate Community Service. DEF is employed at Hudson Machine and Tool and is in Army Reserves. MRT coordinator will be contacting DEF. Court confirms address. Adjourned 4:55 p.m.  Probation review hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

From DE's father, Ron on 5-20-15 re: adding this case to DE's current Pplan on 14CF305.  Spoke w/Ron today & advised him that it appears that the costs are payable to Probation & to contact his PO regarding pymts for this case. jaf

From DE's father, Ron requesting to add this case to the DE's current Pplan.  Left v/m with DE's father today stating that the DE may submit that request in writing or meet w/Pymt Clerk & to return my call w/any further Q's. jaf

Probation review hearing on July 27, 2015 at 04:30 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Eric Gordon Johnson DF ATTY: Donald J. Schwab  DF: Corey Michael Pottebaum appeared. Case called 9:14. Atty. Schwab updates the court.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. ADA Johnson will file the count 2 in the amended information today. DE pleads G to Ct 1  in 14CF147 and  guilty of the two misdemeanor charges of obstructing an officer Class A and discorderly conduct. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF147 and Guilty of 2 misdemeanor charges obstructing an officer and disorderly conduct. Sentencing arguments. DE makes a statement.  Crt orders: Deferred JOC on count 1 of 14CF147. On the two misdemeanor counts court orders: 
Conditions of probation
- 2 years probation to run concurrent on each count 
- Probation is to be served concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- 20 hrs communtity service.
- Costs
- Follow all programming recommendations by agent. 
- participate in MRT.
- Maintain sobriety. 
- Impose 60 days St. Croix County jail STAYED. 

Probation reviews to be set quarterly. 
DE to sign up today for probation.  Probation review hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
Agent to provide updates to the court 1 week prior to probation review hearing.
Plea hearing on April 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Atty. Schwab agrees. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
